channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for KS
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for KS

item.title: Report X-2023111298
item.description:
Report X-2023111298

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-21
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER WAS DISPATCHED TO PICKUP LEAKING PACKAGE. RESPONDER RETURNED LEAKER TO DMP.

item.title: Report X-2023111206
item.description:
Report X-2023111206

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-12T22:12:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-18
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was discovered by a manager when opening a trailer in the unloads, It was promptly reported to QA. DescribePack: The liquid leaked through a loose cap and soiled the other contents. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: The leaker was placed in a tote with a liner and the spill was cleaned with absorb-all

item.title: Report X-2023111125
item.description:
Report X-2023111125

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-12T22:12:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-15
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE HANDLER NOTICED THE PACKAGE WAS LEAKING AND NOTIFIED THE MANAGER THE MANAGER THEN NOTIFIED QA. QA PLACED THE PACKAGE IN A LINED TOTE AND CLEANED UP THE SPILL. THE PACKAGE WAS THEN TAKEN TO THE PROCESSING CAGE. DescribePack: BOTH BOTTLES HAD LOOSE CAPS AND LEAKED OUT SOILING THE BOX. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A LINED TOTE.

item.title: Report X-2023110808
item.description:
Report X-2023110808

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-12T22:12:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-06
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: THIS PACKAGE CAME DOWN THE QA CHUTE AND WAS LEAKING. THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A LINED TOTE AND SPILL WAS CLEANED UP. THE PACKAGE WAS THEN TAKEN TO THE PROCESSING CAGE. DescribePack: THE JERRICAN WAS LEAKING OUT FROM AROUND THE CAP SOILING THE BOX. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A LINED TOTE.

item.title: Report X-2023110782
item.description:
Report X-2023110782

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-12T22:12:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-04
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found in the unload upside down in a trailer. QA was called and the package was placed in a plastic lined tote. DescribePack: One bottle leaked out of the cap, staining the other bottles. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a plastic lined tot and brought to QA for processing.

item.title: Report X-2023110754
item.description:
Report X-2023110754

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-12T22:12:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-02
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: WHILE THE PACKAGE HANDLER WAS UNLOADING THE TRAILER, THEY NOTICED THIS PACKAGE WAS LEAKING AND INFORMED THEIR MANAGER. THE MANAGER, QUICKLY INFORMED QA OF THE SITUATION. QA RUSHED OVER TO THE AREA WITH A TOTE LINED WITH A CLEAR, LARGE HAZMAT BAG AND FOLD ABSORB. ONCE THE AREA WAS CLEANED, THEY BROUGHT THE PACKAGE BACK TO QA AND PLACED IN THE HAZMAT PROCESSING CAGE. DescribePack: THE BOTTLE IS CRUSHED IN AT THE SIDE FROM BEING DROPPED AND LOADED ON ITS SIDE. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A TOTE AND CLEANED UP WITH FOLD ABSORB.

item.title: Report X-2023111076
item.description:
Report X-2023111076

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-08T18:13:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-16
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: OUTBOUND SUPERVISOR CALLED IN A HAZMAT LEAKER TO THE DMP. DMP DISPATCHED A RESPONDER WITH FULL PPE AND SPILL CART TO THE LEAKER. RESPONDER ARRIVED AND CONSULTED THE DECISION TREE ON HOW TO RESPOND TO THE LEAKER. RESPONDER FOLLOWED THE DECISION TREE AND CLEANED UP THE SPILL FOLLOWING GUIDLINES. RESPONDER BROUGHT BACK THE LEAKER TO DMP FOR PROPER DISPOSAL.

item.title: Report X-2023111075
item.description:
Report X-2023111075

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-08T18:13:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-15
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A BOX WITH SHIPPING PAPERS AND A FLAMMABLE LIQUID DIAMOND HAZARD LABEL WAS WET IN THE UNLOAD. RESPONDER DISCOVERED A LOOSE CAP ON THE BOTTLE INSIDE BOX. A DESIGNATED RESPONDER PLACED THE BOX IN A LINED SPILL TUB AND TRANSPORTED IT TO THE DMP FOR PROPER DISPOSAL.

item.title: Report X-2023111041
item.description:
Report X-2023111041

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-08T18:13:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-14
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A HAZMAT BOX WITH SHIPPING PAPERS AND A FLAMMABLE LIQUID DIAMOND HAZARD LABEL WAS ON A PALLET WAITING TO BE AUDITED. THE AUDITOR FOUND THAT THE BOX WAS WET AND HAD BEEN LEAKING. THE AUDITOR IS ALSO A DESIGNATED RESPONDER. UPON FURTHER INSPECTION HE FOUND THAT THE CONTAINER INSIDE HAD A LOOSE CAP AND HAD BEEN LEAKING. THE BOX AND RELATED CONTENTS WERE DISPOSED OF THROUGH THE DMP.

item.title: Report X-2023111023
item.description:
Report X-2023111023

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-08T18:13:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-13
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER FOUND THE LEAKING HAZMAT UP IN SMALLS BY SUPERVISOR DESK. RESPONDER CONSULTED THE DECISION TREE ON HOW TO CLEAN UP SPILL. RESPONDER PUT ON FULL PPE AND USED A FULLY STOCKED SPILL CART TO CLEAN UP THE MESS. RESPONDER BROUGHT BACK THE LEAKING HAZMAT FOR PROPER DISPOSAL.

item.title: Report X-2023110617
item.description:
Report X-2023110617

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-07T18:13:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-29
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: QA NOTICED THE PACKAGE ON THE BELT INSIDE A TOTE AND PULLED IT OFF. THEY SAW IT WAS WET AND PLACED ON THE PALLETS. UPON INVESTIGATING THE PACKAGE, I NOTICED THE CONTENTS INSIDE WERE AEROSOL CANS WITHOUT A LABEL ON THE OUTSIDE. THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A TOTE WITH A LINED HAZMAT BAG. DescribePack: THE CAPS TO THE AEROSOL CANS BROKE OFF FROM THE PACKAGE BEING DROPPED. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A TOTE WITH A LINED HAZMAT BAG.
